intro: Quiina decaisneana, commonly known as the yellow quina, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
